metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5116 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
gd_xbm.c in the GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.0, as used in certain custom PHP 5.5.x configurations, allows context-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive information from process memory or cause a denial of service (stack-based buffer under-read and application crash) via a long name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.2
libgd3 - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> php uses the system libgd2

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-3ubuntu0.2').
